member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.NativeAPI.Consts.PortableDevices.DeviceObjectId
member.summary: Pre-defined ObjectID for the DEVICE object.

summary.para: Pre-defined name of a REG_DWORD value that defines the device type, used for representation purposes only. Functional characteristics of the device are decided through functional objects.
This value can be retrieved using IPortableDeviceManager::GetDeviceProperty(...). See WPD_DEVICE_TYPES enumeration for possible values.
Pre-defined name of a REG_SZ/REG_EXPAND_SZ/REG_MULTI_SZ value that indicates the location of the device icon file or device icon resource.

This value can be retrieved using IPortableDeviceManager::GetDeviceProperty(...). This REG_SZ/REG_EXPAND_SZ/REG_MULTI_SZ value is either in the form "file.dll, resourceID" or a full file path to an icon file. e.g.: "x:\file.ico"
Pre-defined name of a REG_DWORD value that indicates the amount of time in milliseconds the WPD Namespace Extension will keep its reference to the device open under idle conditions.
This value can be retrieved using IPortableDeviceManager::GetDeviceProperty(...).
Pre-defined name of a REG_DWORD value that is used as a flag to indicate whether the device should, or should not, be shown in the Explorer view.
This value can be retrieved using IPortableDeviceManager::GetDeviceProperty(...). Meaning of values are: 0 = include, 1 = exclude. 0 is assumed if this value doesn't exist.

Pre-defined name of a REG_SZ or REG_MULTI_SZ value containing content type guids that are used indicate for what content types the portable device namespace should attempt to automatically generate a thumbnail when placing new content on the device.

This value can be retrieved using IPortableDeviceManager::GetDeviceProperty(...). Values should be a string representation of a GUID, in the form '{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}'. By default the portable device namespace attempts to automatically generate thumbnails for WPD_CONTENT_TYPE_IMAGE, if a device does not want this behavior it can set this value to an empty string.

Pre-defined name of a REG_DWORD value that indicates whether a Portable Device is a Mass Storage Class (MSC) device. This is used to avoid duplication of the device in certain views and scenarios that include both file system and Portable Devices.

This value can be retrieved using IPortableDeviceManager::GetDeviceProperty(...). Meaning of values are: 0 = device is not mass storage, 1 = device is mass storage. 0 is assumed if this value doesn't exist.
Pre-defined value identifying the "Windows Media Digital Rights Management 10 for Portable Devices" scheme for protecting content.
This value can be used by drivers to indicate they support WMDRM10-PD. See WPD_DEVICE_SUPPORTED_DRM_SCHEMES.
Pre-defined value identifying the "Portable Device Digital Rights Management" scheme for protecting content.
This value can be used by drivers to indicate they support PDDRM. See WPD_DEVICE_SUPPORTED_DRM_SCHEMES.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.PortableDevices.Guids.EventSystem.DeviceReset
member.summary: This event indicates that the device is about to be reset-and all connected clients should close their connection to the device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.PortableDevices.Guids.EventSystem.DeviceCapabilitiesUpdated
member.summary: This event indicates that the device capabilities have changed. Clients should re-query the device if they have made any decisions based on device capabilities.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.PortableDevices.Guids.EventSystem.StorageFormat
member.summary: This event indicates the progress of a format operation on a storage object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.PortableDevices.Guids.EventSystem.ObjectTransferRequested
member.summary: This event is sent to request an application to transfer a particular object from the device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.PortableDevices.Guids.EventSystem.DeviceRemoved
member.summary: This event is sent when a driver for a device is being unloaded. This is typically a result of the device being unplugged.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.PortableDevices.Guids.EventSystem.ServiceMethodComplete
member.summary: This event is sent when a driver has completed invoking a service method. This event must be sent even when the method fails.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.PortableDevices.Guids.PropertySystem.ContentType
member.summary: This class defines all WPD content types.

summary.para: Description: Indicates this object represents a functional object-not content data on the device.
Description: Indicates this object is a folder.
Description: Indicates this object represents image data (e.g. a JPEG file)
Description: Indicates this object represents document data (e.g. a MS WORD file-TEXT file-etc.)
Description: Indicates this object represents contact data (e.g. name/number-or a VCARD file)
Description: Indicates this object represents a group of contacts.
Description: Indicates this object represents audio data (e.g. a WMA or MP3 file)
Description: Indicates this object represents video data (e.g. a WMV or AVI file)
Description: Indicates this object represents a television recording.
Description: Indicates this object represents a playlist.
Description: Indicates this object represents an album-which may contain objects of different content types (typically-MUSIC-IMAGE and VIDEO).
Description: Indicates this object represents an audio album.
Description: Indicates this object represents an image album.
Description: Indicates this object represents a video album.
Description: Indicates this object represents memo data
Description: Indicates this object represents e-mail data
Description: Indicates this object represents an appointment in a calendar
Description: Indicates this object represents a task for tracking (e.g. a TODO list)
Description: Indicates this object represents a file that can be run. This could be a script-executable and so on.
Description: Indicates this object represents a file that does not fall into any of the other predefined WPD types for files.
Description: Indicates this object represents a calendar
Description: Indicates this object represents a message (e.g. SMS message-E-Mail message-etc.)
Description: Indicates this object represents an association between a host and a device.
Description: Indicates this object represents certificate used for authentication.
Description: Indicates this object represents wireless network access information.

Description: Indicates this object represents a media cast. A media cast object can be though of as a container object that groups related content-similar to how a playlist groups songs to play. Often-a media cast object is used to group media content originally published online.
Description: Indicates this object describes a section of data contained in another object. The WPD_OBJECT_REFERENCES property indicates which object contains the actual data.
Description: Indicates this object doesn't fall into the predefined WPD content types
Description: This content type is only valid as a parameter to API functions and driver commands. It should not be reported as a supported content type by the driver.

member.summary: No particular content type has been detected or specified. This value is not supported in Windows 7 and later systems.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.Guids.FolderTypes.Invalid
member.summary: The folder is invalid. There are several things that can cause this judgement: hard disk errors-file system errors-and compression errors among them.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.Guids.FolderTypes.Documents
member.summary: The folder contains document files. These can be of mixed format.doc-.txt-and others.

member.summary: Image files-such as .jpg-.tif-or .png files.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.Guids.FolderTypes.Music
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains audio files-such as .mp3 and .wma files.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.Guids.FolderTypes.MusicIcons
member.summary: A list of music files displayed in Icons view. This value is not supported in Windows 7 and later systems.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.Guids.FolderTypes.Games
member.summary: The folder is the Games folder found in the Start menu.

member.summary: The Control Panel in category view. This is a virtual folder.

member.summary: The Control Panel in classic view. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.Guids.FolderTypes.Printers
member.summary: Printers that have been added to the system. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.Guids.FolderTypes.RecycleBin
member.summary: The Recycle Bin. This is a virtual folder.

member.summary: The software explorer window used by the Add or Remove Programs control panel icon.

member.summary: A default library view without a more specific template. This value is not supported in Windows 7 and later systems.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.Guids.FolderTypes.NetworkExplorer
member.summary: The Network Explorer folder.
